concepts.concept_name: Nutrition in organisms: autotrophic and heterotrophic

in_scope: Definition and criteria of life processes
Autotrophic nutrition: photosynthesis — raw materials, site, mechanism, equation
Human digestive system: organs, enzymes, absorption
Anaerobic respiration: fermentation in yeast and muscles
Transport in plants: xylem (water, minerals), phloem (food)
Human circulatory system: heart (double circulation), blood vessels, blood components
Human excretory system: kidneys, nephron structure, urine formation
Excretion in plants: oxygen, carbon dioxide, resins, gums
out_of_scope: Basic plant and animal nutrition — Covered in Class 7
Detailed biochemistry of photosynthesis (Calvin cycle, light reactions) — Class 11
Krebs cycle and electron transport chain — Class 11
Detailed nephron physiology and counter-current mechanism — Class 11

concepts.concept_name: Nervous system: neurons, reflex arcs, brain structure
Coordination in plants: tropic and nastic movements
Hormones in animals: endocrine glands and their functions
Plant hormones: auxin, gibberellin, cytokinin, abscisic acid

in_scope: Need for control and coordination in organisms
Neuron structure: cell body, dendrite, axon, nerve ending
Synapse and transmission of nerve impulse
Human brain: cerebrum, cerebellum, medulla oblongata — functions
Plant movements: phototropism, geotropism, chemotropism, hydrotropism, thigmotropism
Plant hormones: auxin, gibberellin, cytokinin, abscisic acid, ethylene
Endocrine glands: pituitary, thyroid, adrenal, pancreas, gonads
Hormones: thyroxine, insulin, adrenaline, growth hormone, testosterone, estrogen
out_of_scope: Basic nervous system overview — Covered in Class 7-8
Detailed neurophysiology (action potential, neurotransmitters) — Class 11
Detailed endocrinology and hormonal pathways — Class 11
Detailed mechanism of muscle contraction — Class 11

concepts.concept_name: Asexual reproduction: fission, budding, fragmentation, regeneration, spore formation, vegetative propagation
Sexual reproduction in humans: male and female reproductive systems

in_scope: Importance of reproduction for species survival
DNA copying and variation during reproduction
Asexual reproduction: binary fission, multiple fission, budding, fragmentation, regeneration, spore formation
Vegetative propagation: natural and artificial (layering, cutting, grafting)
Flower structure: sepals, petals, stamens, carpels
Fertilization in plants, seed and fruit formation
Male reproductive system: testes, vas deferens, urethra, penis
Female reproductive system: ovaries, fallopian tubes, uterus
Contraceptive methods: barrier, chemical, surgical, IUDs
out_of_scope: Basic reproduction concepts — Covered in Class 8
Detailed embryology and developmental biology — Class 12
Meiosis mechanism in detail — Class 11
Detailed plant embryology — Class 12

in_scope: Mendel's laws: dominance, segregation, independent assortment
Monohybrid cross: genotypic and phenotypic ratios (3:1)
Human evolution: tools, brain size, migration (overview)
Evolution should not be equated with progress
out_of_scope: Basic heredity concepts — Covered in Class 8
Molecular basis of inheritance (DNA structure, replication) — Class 12
Hardy-Weinberg principle — Class 12
Detailed population genetics — Class 12

concepts.concept_name: Food chains, food webs, and energy flow

in_scope: Trophic levels and energy flow (10% law)
out_of_scope: Basic food chain concepts — Covered in Class 6-7
Detailed ecosystem ecology and succession — Class 12
Biogeochemical cycles in detail — Class 11
Environmental impact assessment — Class 11-12

concepts.concept_name: Water management: dams, water harvesting, watershed management
Coal and petroleum conservation and sustainable development

in_scope: Need for management of natural resources
Forests and wildlife: stakeholders and their roles
Water management: dams — advantages and disadvantages
Water harvesting: traditional and modern methods
Coal and petroleum: formation and limited availability
Five R's: Refuse, Reduce, Reuse, Repurpose, Recycle
Ganga Action Plan and river pollution
out_of_scope: Basic natural resource concepts — Covered in Class 6-8
Detailed environmental policies and legislation — Class 11-12
Renewable energy technologies in detail — Class 11
Detailed biodiversity conservation strategies — Class 12
